page.title: 08WEST LOW HOUSE FARM, WHALTON
page.content: This farm of 96 ares plus 100 acres of rented land is run by a manager as a dairy unit. They keep 120 Fresian x Holsteins as well as 70 heifers. The farm has a 14-14 herringbone milking parlour which is computerised and automatically delivers the correct amount of food for each cow. The cows are milked twice a day during the summer but three times a day from October to May when they are kept in and fed on silage. About 70 acres are used for silage with 50 acres of winter wheat, fodder beet and peas. The average field size is 12 acres and the farm has 3 tractors and a forage box for feeding. The unit is run by 1 man at the moment although until recently there were 2.
